column4: hi all,  every time I boot the machine I usually issue the command "sudo hdparm -B 255 /dev/sda"... instead of doing this manually and entering the password everytime,  I added "hdparm -B 255 /dev/sda" to /etc/rc.local but it isn't running the command. any ideas ?   thanks
see /etc/hdparm.conf
no problem
the keyword is the hex value I get in the error right ?
yep
I followed the first 2 steps successfully.. but when I issue "sudo apt-get add -" it hangs there forever after I enter my pass
update-rc.d
or install rcconf or bum (this one graphical)
xubuntu then install programs as you see fit
ok thanks.  I have a 9.04 xubuntu from few months ago, can I just install that or do iso's get updated as well ?
install that... isos are not updated
skype is aviable in medibuntu
ah ok got it.  thanks.   is anything wrong with Skype-Mid btw ?
dunno; do not use either of them
yes is needed by gnome
ok i'll uninstall then. thanks
kde equivalent is KIO afaik
is in partner repositorie
hmm I see.  it's strange that openoffice installed fine, it just crashes on startup after splash screen
thanks
ask in #upstart maybe you need to do a upstart job that will be a precondition for /etc/init/gdm.conf
see here https://help.ubuntu.com/community/EOLUpgrades
